property.name: Text
property.value:
Uses (8 ammo).
η Spend 1-5 ammo: Fight. You get +X ή for this attack. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals X damage. X is the amount of ammo spent as part of this ability's cost.

property.name: Text
property.value:
You can only include this asset in your deck by upgrading it from Ancient Stone (Unidentified), and only if you have "identified the stone" in your Campaign Log.
Uses (X secrets). X is the number in parentheses next to "you have identified the stone."
ι When you draw any number of cards, spend that many secrets: Deal that much damage to an enemy at your location.

property.name: Text
property.value:
You can only include this asset in your deck by upgrading it from Ancient Stone (Unidentified), and only if you have "identified the stone" in your Campaign Log.
Uses (X secrets). X is the number in parentheses next to "you have identified the stone."
ι When you draw any number of cards, spend that many secrets: Heal that much horror from a card at your location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Evade. Add your έ to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed by 2 or more and the evaded enemy is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

property.name: Text
property.value: Gain 1 resource for each action you performed this turn (including this one). If it is your turn, end your turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: Discard a μ asset you control. Then, draw 3 cards or gain 3 resources, or any combination thereof.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Seal (+1 or ε).
You get +1 ά, +1 έ, +1 ή, and +1 ί.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Limit 1 per investigator.
Discard On Your Own if you control an asset that takes up an ally slot.
ι When you play a ξ event, exhaust On Your Own: Reduce that event's cost by 2.

property.name: Text
property.value: α: -1 (-3 instead if you have 5 or more cards in your hand). γ: -3. If you fail, discard 1 random card from your hand. β or δ: -2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.

property.name: Text
property.value: α: -2 (if you have 5 or more cards in your hand, you automatically fail instead). γ: -3. For each point you fail by, discard 1 random card from your hand. β or δ: -2. Place 1 of your clues on your location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Investigators cannot put [[item]] assets into play (including [[item]] weaknesses).

property.name: Text
property.value: As you traverse these strange halls, you come across a chamber you hadn't noticed before. It is filled with trinkets and items of all kinds from various civilizations. Many of them match the descriptions you have given to the city's inhabitants—descriptions of the equipment you had on your person when you first encountered the creatures. Have they somehow replicated the objects you had with you? You take what you can find and continue exploring. Each investigator searches the top 9 cards of his or her deck for up to 2 [[item]] assets and draws them. Shuffle each searched deck. Investigators are now able to put [[item]] assets into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. If The Custodian is in play and not controlled by an investigator, move it to the location with the most clues on it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. If The Custodian is in play and not controlled by an investigator, move it to the location with the most clues on it. Check your supplies. If an investigator has a pendant, that investigator reads the following: As you spend more and more time in the alien city, your memories of the past continue to fade. Then, a spark of hope returns to you, and you recall an object you once carried with you, one that brought you comfort when times were tough. You sift through the objects the Yithians replicated from your descriptions, and there you find it: a pendant on a silver chain. As you hold it, your real identity comes flooding back. Each investigator with a pendant draws 2 cards. For the remainder of the scenario, each investigator with a pendant ignores any effect that would reduce his or her maximum hand size.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator's maximum hand size is reduced by 4.

property.name: Text
property.value: You forget all that you once were. Your name, and your humanity, are lost. However, the lost city of Pnakotus calls to you, its peaceful halls a treasure trove of knowledge more vast than anything your mind could have comprehended before your arrival here. Your purpose lost in the haze, you live out your days with the Great Race of Yith, until one day... Each surviving investigator is defeated.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each copy of Yithian Observer gains aloof.

property.name: Text
property.value: You explore the area near your interview chamber for some time, learning more of this city and its dwellers. It is a place of knowledge and research, inhabited by beings who call themselves the Great Race of Yith. For the most part, the Yithians allow you to explore the city without troubling you, though some of them follow you about and observe you with keen interest. As you pass through one of the city's meandering halls, you find a panel attached to the wall. It is a technological device you cannot hope to understand. As you stand in front of it, dumbfounded, one of your observers approaches cautiously. It extends one of its claw-appendages and manipulates the panel in a convoluted manner. To your surprise, the wall in front of you slides open to reveal another series of halls. The creature steps aside to let you pass. Put each set-aside location into play (Great Library, Laboratory of the Great Race, Yithian Orrery, Deconstuction Room, and Towers of Pnakotus). Choose one of those locations at random. Put the set-aside The Custodian asset into play at the randomly chosen location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Objective - If three of the following are true, you must advance: —An investigator "found the process." —An investigator "dissected an organ." —An investigator "interviewed a subject." —An investigator "realized what year it is." —An investigator "activated the device." —An investigator controls The Custodian.

property.name: Text
property.value: You believe you have discovered the process used by the Yithians to transport you here. But the truth is hard to accept. Your body was never brought to this place. Your mind has been transferred into the body of one of these creatures. Somewhere, in another place-in another time-one of the reviled creatures dwells in your body. You no longer have to perform any of the following tasks. However, the more you have performed by the time the scenario ends, the easier the transition to your human body will be, and the less likely the process is to fail or backfire. Be careful... Place this act in the victory display with this side faceup, as a reminder. -An investigator "found the process." -An investigator "dissected an organ." -An investigator "interviewed a subject." -An investigator "realized what year it is." -An investigator "activated the device." -An investigator controls The Custodian.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each Yithian Observer gains hunter. η Spend 1 clue: Draw. Draw 2 cards instead of 1. If your hand exceeds your maximum hand size, draw 1 additional card. Objective - If each surviving investigator has 10 or more cards in his or her hand, immediately advance.

property.name: Text
property.value: The machine whirs with intense vibration. It has taken many hours to construct, and you have had to build it in secret, using the knowledge you have gathered from the various areas within the city. It is a strange device of rods, wheels, and glass, about the size of a small filing cabinet. A circular mirror in the center sends your alien reflection staring back at you. You activate the device, and you feel a tugging on your psyche, stretching your consciousness across the aether of space and time. The memories come flooding back. (->R1)

property.name: Text
property.value: Each of your [[ally]] assets gains the [[yithian]] trait. ι After you commit a card to a skill test you are performing: Double the skill icons on that card. (Limit once per test.) ε effect: +2. Draw 1 card.

property.name: Text
property.value: Deck Size: What it used to be, when you were human. Deckbuilding Options: Yithians can't build decks. Deckbuilding Requirements: Do you remember...?

property.name: Text
property.value: ι After you begin your turn in this location, if there is a [[Yithian]] enemy in this location: Draw 1 card.

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Parley. Test έ (4) or ή (4) to interrogate the captive mind restrained here. If you succeed, remember that you "interviewed a subject." If you fail, take 2 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced - After you enter this location: Test ά (3). Take 1 horror for each point you fail by.

property.name: Text
property.value: θ During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Halls of Pnakotus. (Limit once per turn.)

property.name: Text
property.value: θ During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Halls of Pnakotus. (Limit once per turn.)

property.name: Text
property.value: θ During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Halls of Pnakotus. (Limit once per turn.)

property.name: Text
property.value: η Spend 1π clues: Test έ (3) to decipher the information you've found. If you succeed, remember that you have "found the process." Forced - At the end of the round, if there are fewer than 4 clues on Great Library: Add clues to Great Library until there are 4 clues on it.

property.name: Text
property.value: η η If there are no clues on Yithian Orrery: Remember that you "realized what year it is." While you are in the Yithian Orrery, increase your maximum hand size by 2.

property.name: Text
property.value: η If there are no clues on Laboratory of the Great Race: Test ί (3) to manipulate the controls on the technological device nearby. If you succeed, remember that you "activated the device." If you fail, place 1 clue on Laboratory of the Great Race .

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Test ή (4) to attempt to retrieve a valuable organ from one of the alien cadavers. This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue on Deconstruction Room. If you succeed, remember that you "dissected an organ."

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Discard any number of cards from your hand. Shuffle your discard pile into your deck and draw cards equal to 1 more than the number of cards you discarded. (Limit once per turn.)

property.name: Text
property.value: ι When the investigation phase begins, if The Custodian is controlled by a player: Each investigator at its location draws 1 card. η If The Custodian is not controlled by a player: Parley. Test έ (3) to converse with the library custodian. If you succeed, something about its mannerisms seems familiar to you; place 1 of your clues on it. Then, if there are 1π clues on it, take control of The Custodian.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn - Great Library. Alert. Aloof. If an investigator has "found the process" or "realized what year it is," Keeper of the Great Library loses aloof and gains hunter.

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn - Laboratory of the Great Race. Aloof. If an investigator has "activated the device" or "dissected an organ," Scientist of Yith loses aloof and gains hunter.

property.name: Text
property.value: Prey - Most cards in hand. Forced - When Scholar from Yith attacks you: Discard 2 random cards from your hand. η If Scholar from Yith is ready and engaged with you: Parley. Test έ (3) to attempt to pass as a member of the creature's race. If you succeed, draw 1 card and evade Scholar from Yith. If you fail, Scholar from Yith attacks you.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Put Yithian Presence into play in your threat area. If there is a [[yithian]] enemy at your location, you cannot investigate that location or trigger η abilities on encounter cards. η Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Discard Yithian Presence.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Put Cruel Interrogations into play in your threat area. If any investigator has "interviewed a subject," take 1 horror and Cruel Interrogations gains surge. You cannot take draw actions. η: Test ά (2). If you succeed, discard Cruel Interrogations.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Test ά (5). For each point you fail by, remove the top card of your deck from the game. If there are less than 10 total cards in your hand, deck and discard pile, you are driven insane.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Test ά (0). Regardless of whether this skill test succeeds or fails, choose and discard all but X cards from your hand. X is your modified skill value for this test.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation - Shuffle each card from your hand into your deck and draw an equal number of cards. Shuffle Out of Body Experience into your deck.
